item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Wednesday, October 30, 2024 at 6:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Australia/Lord_Howe is the weirdest timezone (66 points | 13 comments)
2. Matrix 2.0 is here (62 points | 75 comments)
3. Async Rust is not safe with io_uring (17 points | 17 comments)
4. Syncthing Android app discontinued (33 points | 20 comments)
5. Eighteen years of ABI stability (curl) (16 points | 5 comments)
6. Looking into the Nintendo Alarmo (16 points | no comments)
7. Port forwarding between your local machine and Kubernetes (7 points | 1 comment)
8. One weird trick to get the whole planet to send abuse complaints to your best friend(s) (126 points | 16 comments)
9. Using an 8K TV as a monitor (9 points | 9 comments)
10. malloc(0) & realloc(…，0) != 0 (5 points | 3 comments)
11. Observability in distributed systems (5 points | no comments)
12. Time-based retention strategies in Postgres (2 points | no comments)
13. Generative AI and the Programmer (2 points | 2 comments)
14. Wimsey: fast, lightweight and easy data contract library (supporting Pandas, Polars, Arrow + more, via narwhals) (4 points | no comments)
15. AI Flame Graphs (10 points | no comments)
16. Saltproject.io moving all public repos to broadcom.com by end of month (18 points | 15 comments)
17. RIP botsin.space (42 points | 9 comments)
18. How we shrunk our Javascript monorepo git size by 94% (39 points | 15 comments)
19. The question of whether to still allow HTTP/1.0 requests or block them (16 points | 9 comments)
20. Make It Ephemeral: Software Should Decay and Lose Data (10 points | 6 comments)
21. You can now run prompts against images, audio and video in your terminal using LLM (22 points | 1 comment)
22. 1BRC: Nerd Sniping the Java Community (3 points | 1 comment)
23. Object to Your Information Being Used for AI at Meta (WhatsApp) (10 points | 12 comments)
24. On Crafting Painterly Shaders (1 points | no comments)
25. CVE-2024-9632 xorg-x11-server: heap-based buffer overflow privilege escalation vulnerability (11 points | 12 comments)
